task.title: Installing Roller Bearings
task.shortdesc: Detailed procedure for properly installing and adjusting roller bearings in wheel hubs.

prereq.note: Ensure you have clean, high-quality cup grease available.
Verify correct thread direction for the spindle side. Right-hand threads are on the left side of the car, left-hand threads are on the right side.

step.cmd: Pack the hub with clean cup grease.

substep.cmd: Pack the inner cone and rollers thoroughly with grease.
Place inner cone into the larger cup.

step.cmd: Install the dust ring with felt washer.
step.info: Drive it into the inner end of the hub until flush.

step.cmd: Mount the wheel assembly onto the spindle.
step.info: The inner cone should have a slip fit (one-thousandth) on the spindle - no forcing required.

step.cmd: Prepare and install the outer cone assembly.

substep.cmd: Pack the outer cone and rollers with cup grease.
Place the cone on the spindle.
Tighten until the wheel binds slightly.
Rotate the wheel several times to ensure proper contact.
Back off the cone ¼ to ½ turn.
substep.stepresult: Wheel should rotate freely without end play.

info.note: To distinguish between loose bearings and loose spindle bushings, insert a cold chisel between axle and spindle while testing.

step.cmd: Install the spindle washer and nut.

substep.cmd: Verify the cone adjustment hasn't changed by rotating the wheel.
Insert the cotter pin to lock the nut.
Fill the hub cap with grease.
Install the hub cap onto the hub.

taskbody.result: The roller bearings should now be properly installed and adjusted for optimal performance.
